The fruits and vegetables are especially fresh and delicious, and having hot pot for dinner is the best choice.","date":"3 months ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"David Sheon","rating":4,"text":"One of the very big tea plantation in Cameron, visited during public holidays, the place was packed with local and tourists visitors. Went to take the electric small bus ride down to the farm cost RM20 and was given a pack of teas as well. It was a short ride and I think it was a bit overpriced. If you prefer to walk, just pay RM4.00.","date":"3 months ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Harry Radzuan","rating":5,"text":"Really beautiful lookout point with shops restaurant and they have toilets over here as well. Parking isn't difficult on weekdays but could be a struggle on weekends and peak seasons. I would recommend their durian milk tea as it's their authentic version of durian tea here.  Their masala tea isn't too bad either.","date":"8 months ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Mahmud Siddique (Bishal)","rating":5,"text":"First time saw a gigantic tea plantation.
Never knew it could be that beautiful & have multiple activities.","date":"3 weeks ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Felix M.","rating":4,"text":"I really like it here. You pay 4 RM to walk-in, what’s totally fine. Buggy service would cost 20 RM but I recommend to walk instead. It’s not far and very easy. And then you can enjoy the nice view. Also I recommend to walk the street …","date":"Edited 3 months ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Teo Jing Yang","rating":5,"text":"Another great tourist attraction in Cameron which is worth your visit. You can park your car at the roadside away from the point view and walk to the destination. The view is magnificent and if you are lazy to walk down, shuttle service is …","date":"a year ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Clémence Ailhaud","rating":5,"text":"Very easy to go to see the tea plantations, you can just go to the view point and not pay to all inside, but I recommend doing it, it’s cheap and if you’re scared to walk bc it’s hot then you can pay more to get a lift down the plantation …","date":"a year ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Ællard van Schaik","rating":4,"text":"Nice tea plantation valley, easy acces next to the main road, but it’s loosing some of it charme as it’s being turned into a commercial fun fair park with all colourful items and attractions that are impacting the natural view of an tea plantation.","date":"4 months ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"CP Lee","rating":5,"text":"The heaven was smiling down on us when we visited in August. It was sunny & cool , with clear skies to enhance our first ever proper visit to CH as a family group of tourists so we loved the experience. …","date":"a year ago","helpful_count":0},{"reviewer_name":"Shihab Khan","rating":5,"text":"Nice view of the tea plantations but nothing else.
